inn1.comm: In the Pollock channel: outside off stump and slides away, left alone. Two slips in place.
And again. A touch wider with a bit of bounce. Gilchrist moves back and across and gets into the position for a cut but resists
Almost sucked into a slash-drive this time. Again a touch wider, Gilchrist went back and across, shaped for a drive but pulled out at the last minute. Will the next ball bend back in?
Nope. Goes on with the angle, but much closer to the off stump and Gilchrist moves into the line and drives to mid-off
similar delivery, Gilchrist pushes it to right of mid-off and the first runs are on the board.
Classy straight drive. Full-pitched on the off and middle stump line, Hayden leant forward and punched through the line, past the bowler.
Full in length, angling away from Gilchrist who square-drives and it goes to right of point.
Overpitches it on the legs and Gilchrist jumps on to it. Stays where he is -doesn't get the front foot across and on-drives it past mid-on
on a length, around middle and off stump line, pushed to the off side.
full and straight, on the middle and leg, Gilchrist comes into the line, whips it past square-leg and by the time Pollock gets across from deep backward square-leg, they will run two.
rushed through the channel outside off stump, left alone

Ntini is yet to settle down. Again on the legs and Gilchrist flicks it away past square-leg and again Pollock has to run around again. He is not going to be impressed with that. The poor fellow has to bowl.
Another four. Australia are off to a flier. On the middle and leg, on a length but Hayden just knives through the line past mid-on. Lovely punch at the point of impact and that imparts velocity
on the middle stump line, punched down the track, it hits the sticks on the other side, richochets towards mid-on and they rush across for a quick single
Now Gilchrist joins in the party. Slightly short in length, outside off and Gilchrist cuts, to the ground, and Gibbs dives to get some touch on it.
Classy cover drive. Full-pitched on the off stump line - no movement whatsover on this batting paradise- and Gilchrist eases forward to smoke it through covers.
another one full in length, in the slot, outside off stump, Hayden drives but straight to mid-off
Hayden is standing inside the crease. Occasionally, to impose himself on the bowlers and also depending on the track, he stands outside. Not today. leans forward to drive to right of mid-off
Splat! Another one on a length and outside off, Gilchrist leans forward, drives through the line and through the cover region. Fab stroke.
Look at the flashing blade! Another one in the slot and Gilchirst leans forward, awesome balance and  whacks it through covers. Gilchrist is having a party out there.
drags back the length, on the middle and off stump line, Gilchrist goes back, pushes it out towards mid-off
a dot ball! whoa! Landed just outside leg stump, shaped in towards off stump, Gilchrist drives, the bat-face shuts and the ball goes on to the pad and bounds off it.. down the track.
Short and wide and you know that one ended up. Fierce cut. Blink. The ball is being picked up from the point boundary.
length-delivery, pushed across Hayden who watches it sail into Boucher's gloves
Boom! Boom! A shimmy down the track and he imposes himself: Swings it over the cow corner. Australia are on zooming here.

He can only watch as this one sails over long-on. This is a great batting track. Off-cutter on the off stump line and Hayden leans forward and whacks it through the line. Up.... up and over. Smith goes into a huddle with Pollock. Two sixes in a row. What can he do? Importantly what will Pollock do now?
It's not all violence. A cute cut shot brings up the fifty. In under 5 overs. Length-delivery on the off stump line, cut to third man region.
lands on a length, on the off stump line, Gilchirst goes back, opens the bat-face, pushes it to Gibbs at point. Hayden will be on strike.
lands on the leg stump line, angles past the off stump with the usual Ntini angle. Hayden leaves it alone. Hayden is on 27 from 12 balls.
lands outside leg stump, moves in towards leg and middle, Hayden clips it off the hips, through midwicket.
on the off and middle stump line, Hayden shapes to cut, cramped for room, pushes it to point
fuller, on the off stump line and Hayden drives powerfully but straight to mid-off.
back of length, on the middle and off stump line, Hayden dabs it to midwicket for a single.

Flies past the diving Prince at cover. Full and outside off stump and it veers further away. Gilchrist stretches out and slashes it , in the air, past cover. Prince goes airbourne but can't grab the cherry. What a frenetic start!
lands on a length, on the off stump line, goes on straight, cut down to point
full in length, just outside off stump and Hayden leans back, opens the bat-face and runs it down, delectably, to third man region.
full in length, driven to bowler
fuller and outside off stump, Hayden leans forward and square-drives. Not much of a follow-through but some timing there. And a good bat of course.
length-delivery on the off stump line, pushed to cover
full in length, straightens, on the off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
full-pitched on the off stump line, driven to mid-on
in the channel outside off stump, not much room for Hayden to work with, dabbed to point
full in length, on the middle stump line, pushed back to Ntini.
again full and moving through the corridor outside off, Hayden is sitting in the bedroom and watches it sail past him
full and on the legs, driven straight to mid-on and Hayden is disappointed with himself for wasting that half-volley
length-delivery, around off stump, played towards point
on the middle stump line, pushed back to Pollock.
Overpitched outside off stump, Gilchrist's eyes lit up  - Did I see it? No.. poetic licence.. - and crashes it through the off side but sends it straight to cover.
Third dot ball in a row. On the middle stump, on a length, punched back to Pollock.
127.2 kmph, on the off stump line, pushed to mid-off and Hall is standing deep there and the batsmen rush across for a quick single
on the middle stump line, pushed again to Hall and another single.
Full in length, on the middle and leg stump line and Gilchrist goes for a pull. Not the length for it but he still swings his bat across and sends it to Prince at deep square-leg

pitches outside leg stump, moves towards off stump, Gilchrist wants to drive through the line - this is a perfect pitch for those strokes- but he goes hard at it, the bat-handle rotates and the ball rolls over to the leg side

Very small boundaries here and Australia are cashing in. Full in length, on the middle stump line and Hayden shapes to loft it over the bowler's head, again the bat-handle rotates, and the inside-edge takes it to square-leg boundary. Hmm...
Whack! Length-delivery on the off stump line has been crashed through the gap between the bowler and mid-off. Almost took out Gilchrist.
around the off stump, turned to point
on the off stump line, run down to third man region
another one angling away from Gilchrist, cut to backward point
tip and run. Length-delivery on the off stump line and Hayden plays with soft hands - yeah he is capable of that, don't look surprised, drops it in front of him and off they go in a flash for a run
slightly short in length and Gilchrist shapes to pull. Not the length and the ball drops in front of him as he is unable to make proper contact
fuller this time, outside off and stabbed away to cover point
attempts a yorker, ends up as a low full-toss and Gilchrist drives straight - again he is going a bit too hard in his drives and the bat-handle keeps turning- back to the bowler who kicks it away.
This one has disappeared over long-leg. Full in length, on the leg and middle and Gilchrist swings it across, like Jayasuriya, and it lands amidst the crowd.
back of length and it skids on to the middle peg, pushed to the off side.
lands on a length, skids on, defended on the front foot
change of pace. Slow off cutter, on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket.
brings up his fifty. In style. Outside off stump, on a length, and Hayden knives through the line, on the up, and through widish mid-off.
beaten. That's a surprise. Floats a swinger outside off stump, full in length, Hayden has a nibble and is beaten.
on the middle stump line, driven to mid-on.
full in length,, on the off stump line, Gilchrist leans forward, drives, with the full face of the bat, to mid-off
short in length, doesn't bounce as much as Gilly expected and his attempted pull shot is not profitable. The ball rushes past the inside-edge and to Boucher.
full in length, lands on the off stump line, skids on, Gilchrist's bat comes down in an angle and gets a inside-edge on to the pad
on the hips, from a length, Gilchrist short-arm jabs it, in the air, but it falls short of Prince at deep backward square-leg
close to the off stump, not much room for Hayden to cut, so ... he opens the face of the blade and runs it down to third man.
There comes the adrenalin rush. Hayden backs away, exposing the stumps, Hall homes in on the middle stump with a near-yorker, jabbed to cover point
strays on to the pads, Hayden leans forward, clips it to fine-leg. Easy pickings.

Clubbed away. A flat six over long-off. 100 is up. This man is in some mood. Full-pitched on the off stump line, Hayden takes his front leg out of the line and biffs it flat, fast and over mid-off. It ends up screaming over long-off as well.
beaten. Pre-determined heave across the line as Hayden goes for the jugular. Slanting in from round the stumps and he tries to swing it across the line and the ball teases the off stump.
full and on the off and middle stump line, coming in with the angle and not much room to work with, drives back to the bowler.
goes for a yorker, but it ends up a swinging half-volley on the legs, Gilchrist is quick to latch on to it and clips it through midwicket. Good intent but the execution goes wrong
around the off stump, slides on with the arm, Gilchrist shapes to cut but it is too close to the off stump and he gets an inside-edge and it rolls over, dangerously, close to the off stump.
on the middle stump line, nudged to midwicket
fuller and outside off stump, Gilchrist has a swipe across the line and the ball rolls towards mid-on

Soft dismissal. South Africa heave a sigh of relief. A slower one on the off stump line and Gilchrist is done in by the change in pace. He shapes to cut but the ball stops on him and he sends a dolly to Gibbs at backward point. What a frenetic start it has been. It was all on a fast-forward motion. No pause or stop button in sight. Until this happenned.
full in length, on the off and middle stump line, Ponting hops back, turns it towards midwicket
Full in length, Hayden leans forward and crashes it through extra cover.
on the middle and leg, on a length, worked to mid-on
on the middle stump line, Ponting leans forward and defends
length-delivery on the middle stump line, punched towards midon but de Villiers intercepts from midwicket with a full-lenght dive
fuller, on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket
full in length, outside off stump and thumped over cover. he is making it look real easy out there. Lean forward, move towards the ball and just knive through the line.
lands on a length, on the off and middle stump line, Hayden gets behind the line, pushes it to the off side
There he goes again. Another length-delivery on the off stump line and Hayden decides this one has to. So goes through his routine: leans forward and hits through the line, up and over mid-on.
slips down the leg side and Hayden swivels to pull, ends up lapping it around the corner
length-delivery on the middle stump line, pushed back to the bowler
on the off stump line, pushed towards mid-off
lands outside off stump, cuts back in a touch, Ponting lunges forward, pushes it on the up, to cover
full and on the middle stump line, Ponting eases forward, flicks it behind square-leg
from round the stumps, comes a dolly down the leg side. All Hayden needed to do was to get a tickle and he does it.
on the hips, pushed to midwicket. He must have got bored of hitting boundaries.
overpitched on the middle stump line, driven to the bowler
easy single with a drive to mid-on
On a length but outside the off stump and Hayden latches on the width and cuts it to deep point
swing and a miss. Down the leg side and Ponting tries to play a pick-up shot.
length-delivery on the off stump line and Ponting lunges forward, pushes it to cover
fuller, on the leg and middle stump line, Ponting shapes to drive through the line, misses and the ball thuds into the pad. Going down leg side.
bit of rubbish down the legside and Ponting clears the bin with a flick of the wrists.
on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket for a single. 91 off 60. Davison holds the fastest WC ton. 100 in 67 balls.
pitches on a length, around the off stump line, cut to point
Clatter! Ponting joins in the carnage. Full-pitched, on the middle stump line and Ponting swings it over wide long-on. It lands on the roof.
It's raining sixes and fours here. South Africans are not enjoying the downpour. Ponting leans forward and lofts a fullish delivery over the bowler's head
Back of a length just outside off, Hayden pats it back to the bowler. Ponting has just beaten Sourav Ganguly's record for the most World Cup sixes. He has 26 at the moment
cut away for a single to the sweeper
good bounce from Langeveldt, rising after pitching outside off, Ponting glides it to third man for a single
speared down leg side, Hayden goes for the flick but can't make contact. Wide called. There have been just three extras in the innings so far, no time in between the fours and sixes it seems
Cut away fiercely for a single. South Africa have a cover at deep point. They probably need cover everywhere.
Back of a length again and outside off, Ponting gets the width to cut but can't time it right. Straight to point.
Short and some spongy bounce there. Ponting pulls it away for a single. The fifty partnership is up in 38 deliveries. Australia in line for a big one here. Maybe a huge one
Good length and outside off, Ponting walks across but is cramped for room, jams his bat down and plays it to mid-on

Short and some more tennis-ball bounce that time. Ponting is too early on the pull and the ball balloons away to short third man for a single. It's a dangerous ploy bowling short to Ponting. He plays that shot better than anyone else
Slightly straighter, slipping down leg and short. Hayden simply whips it away off his pads for a single
Driven to mid-on. Cramped for room again
Patted back to mid-on. Hall more controlled in this over. Nothing wayward yet. A quiet five deliveries
Good end to the over. Short of a length and outside off, Ponting taps it straight to point and doesn't think of a run. Maybe he needs to get to know how it feels to play out dots as well
Slightly flighted outside off and Hayden plays it back
Down the track and wallops it way over the bowler for a six. Hundred in 66 deliveries. The fastest World Cup hundred. Beating John Davison's record. Brings is up in brutal style
turned away to square leg
defended to the leg side. He seems to be lining up a big one
Flighted on middle, turns a bit. Ponting gets a thick outside edge and the ball trickles away to the off side
Turned away to midwicket for a single
Full outside off, Ponting pats it to the off side
Full and outside off again, Ponting on his front foot and chipped the ball through mid-on for a single. It was a catch if there was mid-on. If ...

Over. Extra bounce from Kallis and Hayden goes for the cut. On the back foot and punching away but can't keep it down. Can't get it above Gibbs at point, who snaffles a straightforward chance and jumps up in glee. A tame end to a violent innings. But what a knock! Mat the Bat at his devastating best
Bouncer to start with. Good morning Mr Clarke. Struck on the glove and loops up to the off side.
Full and outside off, defended back to the bowler
Slower ball from Kallis and Clarke whips it wide of mid-on and charges through a single
slow through the line, Clarke steps down the track and check his stroke and pushes it to long-on
short in length, Ponting waits on it and pulls it away to deep square-leg

Almost a run out. On the middle stump line, Clarke gets into  a tangle by pushing his left leg across and then laps it around the corner to short fine leg. There is  a throw at the non-striker's end but Clarke makes it in time
again short in length, Ponting moves forward and pulls it to deep square-leg
shuffles across, nudges one through square-leg
again short. Smith is expecting that Ponting would be charging down the track I guess.. but Ponting just stands there and pulls it
full-pitched, driven to long-on
off-cutter outside off stump, Clarke leans forward, pushes it towards cover point and they rush across for another single. Gibbs has a shy, misses but Clarke has just made it
on the off stump line, on a length, pushed to cover
on the middle stump line and Ponting lunges forward in his characteristic fashion and drives to long-on
slower one, 112.7 kmph, on the off stump line, driven to cover
on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket
on the off stump line, pushed to cover
off-cutter - a slew of offcutters are being employed, pushed to midwicket
on the middle stump line, on a length, worked to short midwicket
drifting on to the pads, Clarke tries to flick, misses. So does Boucher. Wide called.
lands on the off stump line, moves in and Ponting is rapped on the pad as he pushes forward in defense
off cutter on the off stump line, punched on the up, through cover
short and outside off stump, Clarke wants to cut but only knives thin air
shuffles across, nudges a length-delivery to square-leg
wonderfully placed. Off-cutter on the off and middle stump line, Ponting moves forward and chips it over midwicket. Ala Carl Hooper.
Full and outside off, slashed away to third man where Pollock produces a neat sliding stop.
lands outside off stump, breaks in a touch, Clarke eases forward, drives on the up, to long-on.
short in length, outside off stump, cut to point. Not well timed as Clarke went too hard at it.

almost a catch at short midwicket. Clarke is bit too early into his push-drive and it flies to the left of short midwicket where de Villiers hurls himself full length but can't reach it. It brushed the finger-tips and runs down to long on. It was a valiant effort. It would be harsh to call it as a dropped chance.
Another single down to long-on. Both the batsmen are looking to get forward and either punch or drive through the line.
off cutter on the middle stump line, Ponting works it to right of midwicket
another half-chance missed. Ponting pushes a length-delivery to left of Prince at cover and they set off for a run. Had the throw been accurate, Clarke would have been a goner.
moves forward, drives to long on

Ouch. Ponting is hit on the helmet. Hall stuns him with a surprise bouncer and Ponting, on the front foot, is beaten by the pace as he shapes to hook. The ball thuds into the protective gear and runs down to fine leg boundary
leans forward, pushes a length-delivery back to the bowler
off cutter, full in length, driven down to long on
full in length and another single down to long on. Can we pick some other spot please?!
edged to third man boundary. Short in length, outside off stump, Ponting goes for a pull, gets a bottom-edge, through the vacant slip region. Pollock looks as if he has been mugged.
Clarke backs away, Pollock hits the deck short of length, and at the body, Clarke pulls but straight to de Villiers at midwicket who fires in a throw at the non-striker's end. Misses.
full in length, on the off stump line, pushed through the line and guess where? Yep .... to long on
almost a mix-up. Clark mistimes a drive towards midwicket, de Villiers rushes in, Ponting is almost in the middle of track but retreats in time
full and straight on the middle stump line, driven to long on
overpitched outside off stump and Clarke creams it inside-out through cover.  He has had enough of those singles down to long on
big hit. Clarke charges down the track and lofts a slower one over long off. The floodgates are again opening. More violence coming up.
Ntini is back. From wide of the crease, on the middle stump line, pushed down the track.
on the middle and leg stump line, it stops on Ponting a touch and he adjusts and pushes it out to midwicket
strays on to the legs and Ponting flicks it past square-leg
short in length, on the middle stump line, Clarke gets behind the line, defends to the on side.
Clarke is getting itchy. He backs away to the leg side, exposing the stumps, and Ntini loves indecent exposure. Homes in on the middle peg and Clarke cuts it to cover
on the middle and leg stump, lapped around the corner
Slogged away. Off cutter on the middle stump line and Clarke slogs it through midwicket. It was in the air and de Villiers dives but again it eludes him.
Sliced away. Fullish, on the off stump line, Clark backs away a touch and smokes it inside-out  over cover.
on the off stump line, Ponting hands the strike back to the rampaging Clarke with a dab to the off side
on the middle and leg stump line, Clarke turns it to left of short fine leg for a single.

banged in short, around off stump and Ponting pulls to deep midwicket. He maintains a great balance while pulling. The best puller in the World. No.. don't send any  naughty ones about whether he is a hooker also..

Very tough chance for Hall at deep cover. It would have been a great catch. Ponting charged down the track and hit on the up over off side. Ended up skying it to right of the sweeper cover where Hall rushes across and pulls out a dive. The ball eludes him. Only just.
short in length and he pulls it past square-leg
length-delivery on the off stump line, guided to right of point where Gibbs makes a diving stop.
They are licking the attack. Another charge down the track, another swing of the bat and the ball is deposited to long off boundary.
low full toss, on the middle peg, driven to long on
length-delivery around off stump, driven on the up, to sweeper cover
banged in short, Clarke backs away, tries to upper cut but is beaten by the extra bounce
short in length, on the middle and leg stump line, Clarke shuffles across and laps it behind square-leg.
Thwack! Another slog. Clarke takes a step or two to the leg side and clubs a shortish delivery to wide long on
Carved away. Again he backs away, this one is hurled full and just outside off, Clarke stretches towards it and slices it past backward point.  SA are in some leather hunt here.
full-pitched, driven to cover
on the legs, flicked away behind square-leg

he smoked that. Fifty up in spectacular fashion. He moves to the leg side and heaves a slower one, inside-out over long-off. It went flat, fast and over the ropes.  Another stunning hit on this feather-bed of a pitch. Barry Richards, on air, murmurs about the long batting line-up of South Africa. Hopefully, we shall have a interesting game.

second six of the over, 4th of Pollock, and this was nonchalantly done. Full in length, around off stump line and Pollock leant forward and chipped it on the up. I thought it would go over mid-off but it just kept sailing. Fab stroke and SA continue to leak runs.
on the legs, swung away to long leg
On the off stump line, defended on the front foot
full in length, drives to cover
slap-slog. Walks down the track and swipes a fullish delivery to long-on
Full, straight and that's enough for Ponting to think he can send it over long-off. Goes for a fierce drive, the bat-handle rotates and the ball heads towards long on
similar delivery and Clarke drills it, along the ground, to long off
from wide of the crease comes a delivery outside off stump, Ponting walks down the track , ala Hayden, and drives powerfully to long off
fullish, on the middle stump line, turned to the on side
slipping down the leg side, flicked to fine leg.
Pollock's nightmarish day continues. A wide down the leg side.
fullish, driven to long on
Leaks another boundary. Full-toss, down the leg side and Pollock flicks it fine. Very fine.
full in length, driven to long-on.
full-pitched outside off stump, driven to cover
overpitched outside the off stump, carved to deep cover
Gibbs drops a dolly. Again overpitched outside off stump, and Clarke slashes it hard but straight to Gibbs at point but ....        Clarke has a smile. Wonder Whether Steve Waugh is watching this.
Walks down the track, drives a fullish delivery to long off
in-swinging delivery, on the middle stump line, driven to long on
Kallis returns with a delivery in the channel outside off stump, full in length, Clarke  stretches out, pushes it to backward point
low dipping full toss, on the off stump line , driven to long off
full-pitched outside off stump, driven to long-off
fullish outside off, driven through the off side

low- full toss, well outside off stump but Ponting is in a greedy mood.  Takes out the bottom-hand, stretches out and drills it to deep point. This is a small boundary and the sweeper cover can't reach it
full, straight and a whack. One bounce to long off.
Clarke is walking all over the crease. he walks towards off, then to leg and crashes a fullish delivery to long on. 300 up.
driven to the extra cover region for a single.
charges out, Hall pushes it full and low, outside off stump, driven to sweeper cover
Whoa! This is the first dot  ball in 15 deliveries. on the off stump line, driven to cover
Brutal! Low full toss, outside off stump and Clarke slashes it to deep point.
smashes down the ground this time but will get only a single.

Drama! Ponting loses his bat but still rushes across for the single. He charged down the track , Kallis hurls a yorker-length delivery and Ponting tried to heave it across. The bat slipped out the hand, flew to the on side,, the ball rolled towards off side and they took the single. Frenetic start and a furious ending.
fullish, on the off stump line, swiped across the line but a good diving stop at midwicket and he will get a single
Swing and a miss. Short in length, outside off stump, and Clarke has one almighty swing. No luck.

Full and straight, on the off stump line, Clarke flashes it down the ground, to left of Prince at long-off who makes a good stop. It dropped awkwardly in front of him, not close to go for the catch, not far to step back and stop.
full and on the off stump line, drilled down the ground, to long on
Similar ball, similar stroke.

The slog started right at the start. It has just escalated in aggression now at the death overs. Full and on the off stump line, down came the flashing blade of Ponting and the ball thuds into the advertising hoardings at wide long on.
outside off stump, on a length, Ponting mis-times a drive, back to the bowler
low full toss, on the off stump line, driven to long off
another full toss, another drive to long off. Previously they were peppering the long on, now to the other side
Deja-vu.
Yorker that whizzes past the off stump. Ponting tries to jab it but can't get a touch
shimmy down the track and slaps a full toss to deep midwicket
Full-tosses galore. So does the sixes. Little Pup goes mad. Drills this one over long-on.

Punter is gone. Caught at long on. Goes down on a bent knee and disposes a fullish delivery down the ground. de Villiers didn't have to move an inch and takes it.  Ponting exits and enter another big-hitter Andrew Symonds. Roy is in. No breathing space for SA.
short in length, off the mark with a cut shot to cover point
Clarke continues to flow. Another low full toss- the yorkers are going awry- and he slices it over point. Lovely use of the bottom-hand there.
rotates the strike with a drive to long off
yorker on the middle stump line, driven down the ground, to long on
Smack! Clarke walks across to the off side, goes on a bent knee and biffs a fullish delivery over long on. He gets in to the 90s.
Comes down the track and heaves a full-length delivery to long off.
short in length, outside off stump, slapped to long on
He walks imperiously down the tack and slices a full-toss through backward point.

Clarke is tragically run out, short of his century. He got to a three-figure mark , last in 2004-05 against Pakistan. The wait is not over yet. Symonds drives a full-pitched delivery to midwicket and stays rooted to the crease. Clarke runs down to the middle of the pitch and turns back. Too late. But what a fabulous knock it has been. Entertaining.
on the off stump line, dabbed down to third man
well outside the off stump, driven to deep cover
Like now. Hussey gives himself room, an attempted yorker is turned into a full-toss and slashed away behind point for a four. Time for a rampage

Holed out. Half-volley on off stump and Hussey tries to loft it over extra cover. Kallis makes good ground and takes a good catch while moving back. Hussey can't manage to clear the short boundary and South Africa limiting the damage here.
yorker length from Hall. Symonds hits it onto his pads and scurries a single.
Driven forcefully to long-off for a single
Good yorker length ball again. Symonds makes room and walks down the track but can't get it on the meat of the bat. Thick under edge goes to long-on for a single
Low full toss outside off, slashed away to the sweeper fielder for a single.
Fullish length and outside off, Watson moves across his stumps but can't sweep it past fine leg. Top edge flies to third man for a single.
That's a blitzer of a flat-batted shot. Symonds simpy gives himself room and launches a most brutal slap through extra-cover for a one-bounce six. When he hits them .. you know the rest
driven to long-off for a single this time, the force is there but not the timing
This time he comes off. Shuffles across the stumps and sweeps to the vacant fine leg region for a four. Classy stuff from Watson, that was treated as if a spinner was bowling. Easy and cool
Full ball on off and Watson creams it over extra cover, not that well timed as the ball drops in front of Ashwell Prince who is running around. Batsmen settle for two

Swept again, this time in front of square for another four. It's too easy - move across and swat. Watson troubling with his cheek. Langeveldt can only watch and despair after his 10 over spell that bled 82
Symonds gives himself room and down the track, swings his bat and the ball races away to deep point. Easy single there
Good yorker. Best ball at this stage. Outside off and Watson jams it out. Can't get a single as the ball trickles back to the bowler
Not this time. Watson tries for another cheeky sweep, by moving way outside off but can't make contact. The ball reaches the wicketkeeper.
Down the track, takes in on the full. Smashed to long-off on the bounce. They settle for a single
Another yorker outside off, Symonds charges again, backs away again but can only jam his bat down and sneak it past point for a brace
What a way to finish. Inswinging yorker that crashes into Symonds's off stump. It was a wonderful over to finish, conceding just four runs in the last over

inn2.comm: lands on a length, curves in, turned to square-leg
length-delivery on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket.
fuller, on the middle and leg stump line, flicked to right of square-leg
Short of length and de Villiers forces it through the off side. There was not much room offered but this is such a nice pitch that de Villiers just hit on the up.
FIrst six of the chase. Comes via thrillingly skillful stroke. It was back of length delivery on the middle stump line and he short-arm jabbed it over deep midwicket. Stunning stroke.
leans forward to defend a length-delivery on the middle stump line.
full and well outside the off stump, left alone. Reaches Gilchrist on one-bounce.
in the zone outside off stump, 147.4 kmph, and Smith has a flash but no wood on leather.
bangs it short, 146.3 k, outside off stump, Smith hops up, gets on top of the bounce and cuts to wide third man
wide down the leg side. He has a slightly round-armish action and this time the right arm never got up.
full, straight, on the legs and on-driven through the midwicket region. Easy pickings. Not much movement of the ball and he whips it away
on the off stump line, 147.4k, pushed to cover
Another wide down the leg side. If you have been following Tait's career, this won't be come as a  surprise.
banged in short, on the leg stump line, de Villiers shapes to pull but is beaten by the pace. Still, manages to get it down to fine leg
rushes through the channel outside off stump, de Villiers shuffles across, covers the off stump and lets it sail past him
131.2 k, on the off stump line, going on with the angle, pushed to the off side. de Villiers is waiting for that slightly short of length delivery.
full in length, pushed to Ponting at mid-off and they get across for a quick single. Ponting, as usual, fires in a direct hit but de Villiers has made his ground
full in length, on the middle stump line, defended on the front foot.
slightly slower in pace. 118 k. Around the off stump line and Smith offers the full face of the bat in defense
nagging line around off stump, on a length and nudged to the on side.
full and straight on the middle stump line, driven to mid-on
149.5 k. Short and furious. Smith pulls that chest-high delivery but mistimes and it rolls over to square-leg
147.4k, full and straight and Smith caresses it straight down the ground. Ponting moves to his left from mid-on and dives over the ball.
full-pitched on the leg and middle stump line, turned towards midwicket for a single
you can bowl fast but you need to hit the right areas. This one is slipping down leg side and de Villiers helps himself to another boundary
149+ k , fast and short but well outside the off stump and a wide is called.
143.5k, on the off and middle stump line, coming in a touch, de Villiers is behind the line, punches on the up, to mid-off
Biffed away. Smith waltzes down the track, backing away in the process, and creams a fullish delivery over mid-off.
shuffles across, gets behind the line of a length-delivery on the off and middle and defends
on the off stump line, pushed to cover region
Overpitched on the middle stump line and what does Smith do? He backs away a touch and drills it straight down the track. Easy. The chase is on.
fullish, on the middle and off stump line, Smith drives through midwicket.
Both can stand and watch as the ball is dabbed down to third man.
No change in the proceedings though. Another four. Full and drifting on to the pads, flicked away
Classy. Elegant off drive. Length-delivery outside off stump and de Villiers eases forward and drives on the up. Past mid-off.
Three in a row. The chase is hurtling along at some pace. Full in length and outside off stump, de Villiers leans forward and opens the bat-face and square-drives it through backward point.
leans forward to defend a length-delivery on the off stump line
cut and a miss. In the temptation zone outside off, short in length and de Villiers shapes to cut
lands on a length, on the off stump line, pushed to the off side
back of length, around off stump, Smith stands tall, dabs it to down to third man
slower one, on the middle stump line, de Villiers plays it quietly to the on side
full in length, going on with the angle, driven to the cover region.
full, lands on the off stump line, angles away, de Villiers goes forward, drives to cover
Ponting makes a good save. All in a day's work for him. de Villiers drives a fullish delivery to left of Ponting at mid-off but he moves across and dives
on a length, outside off, cut to right of backward point where Clarke makes the stop.
probing delivery on the off stump line. Landed on a length and straightened, pushed down to mid-off.
slightly short in length, just outside off and de Villiers rocks back and punches it to Symonds at point
fuller, in the same zone, de Villiers steers it to backward point. Sixth dot ball in a row from McGrath. Smith goes down the track to have a chat with de Villiers.
nagging line on the off and middle stump line, defended on the front foot
on the middle and leg stump line, worked through midwicket
Parsimonious McGrath. Full-pitched on the middle stump line, turned to Hayden at midwicket.
full and on the middle and leg, de Villiers whips it across to deep midwicket
full in length, around the off stump line, Smith leans forward, drives to short cover. Gilchrist runs down to have a chat with Watto. Maybe about the dinner.
Smith backs away, Watson pushes on full and just outside off, Smith reaches it and drives but again Hayden, at short cover, is in the way.
No can intervene that. He has taken the aerial route. Again, he backs away to the leg side and goes through the line. Smooth. Up and over long off.
Watson keeps it full, driven to mid-off
drifting on to the pads, de Villiers misses out an opportunity there.
Smith goes down town. Full-pitched on the off stump line, drilled down the ground.
slower one, on the middle and leg stump line, worked to left of midwicket for a quick single.
full and straight, outside off stump, de Villiers waits for it, leans back, opens the bat-face and guides it to point
de Villiers loves his pull shot. Slightly short in length, on the middle stump line and he swings it behind square-leg.
length-delivery has been hit on the up to mid-off for a yet another single
lands on a length, on the middle and leg stump line, moves towards off, nudged to the on side
de Villiers was sliced in half with that one. straight, on middle stump, de Villiers tries to whip across the line and misses, that missed the stump by a whisker
turned towards deep square leg off the pads
Smith backs away a little  and pushes it off the front foot to mid-off
driveable length outside off, de Villiers drives hard off the front foot but straight to mid-off
Watson gives a little width outside off and de Villiers pushes it hard to the covers, trying to find that gap
drifting on the pads, de Villiers notices the fine leg up and turns it wide of the fielder, easy boundary there
Smith backs away, swings and Tait makes a valiant save at mid-on
fullish on middle, de Villiers gets forward and drives it to mid-on
good length outside off, de Villiers tries to drive it square off the front foot but once again finds the fielder at point
pushed towards point, McGrath keeping these two quiet
outside off, de Villiers opens the face and glides it easily towads third man
drifting on the pads, Smith turns his wrists, tries to beat short fine leg but fails, McGrath lucky to get away with that
sharp single! de Villiers pushes it off the front foot towards mid-off, sets off and just reaches his ground before the throw goes towards the stumps
backs away and biffed with force over midwicket, a lot of bottom hand on that stroke
fuller, Smith dances down the track and hits it hard straight to the diving mid-on
take that! Smith advances down again and deposits it down town over long-on
Smith backs away, Watson holds the length back, Smith adjusts quickly and glides it towards short third man
drifting towards the pads, de Villiers places it wide of short fine leg, the ball heads towards the ropes and a superb save by deep square leg cuts off a certain four
pulled over mid-on, a little streaky though, Tait nearly gets a hand to it but the ball beats him and heads to the boundary, despite a diving attempt by him
steered towards point for no run
yorker, good comeback by McGrath, de Villers watchfully digs that out
low full toss on the legs, flicked away through square-leg
The boundaries keep coming. Full in length, on the off and middle line and de Villiers hits it on the up and over mid-on.
on the hips, clipped to short fine leg
slightly short in length, outside off stump and pulled away to mid-on
full-pitched outside off, de Villiers blasts it to cover where a half-stop is made by Hayden  and it bounds off to Ponting at mid-off who has a shy at the striker's end
Length-delivery on the middle stump line, eased through the midwicket. I describe as if it was just a single but I tell you it has been that kind of a day.
lands on a length, on the middle stump line, driven to mid-on
short in length, on the middle stump line, pulled to midwicket.
lands on the off stump line and turns away, Smith is beaten on the drive.
lands on the off and middle stump line, goes on straight, Smith leans forward and defends. It will be interesting to see how SA play the spinner.
on the middle stump, dabbed to midwicket
on the middle and off stump line, swept fine. That brings up his fifty. 4th against Australia.
on the off stump line, dabbed to third man
Smith is standing slightly outside the leg stump. Interesting. This one is full and straight on the middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler.
backs away a touch, Tait bangs it short, at the body and Smith pulls it weakly to midwicket
fuller, on the middle and leg stump line, Smith drives to deep midwicket. His bat, more often than not, comes down in angle, with a shut-face and his on-drives go square
yorker-length which curved in late and de Villiers does well to get his bat down in a hurry. He gets a inside-edge which takes the ball to fine leg
He moves outside leg stump, exposing all three sticks, and slashes a low full toss, on the middle peg, to third man region.
Again that backing away. In the future if he doesn't do it, I shall mention. Drills a fullish delivery to long-off. Stick cricket continues.
lands on the off and middle, on a length, turns away, whipped to midwicket
topspinner on the off and middle stump line, pushed to cover region for a single. Clarke fires in a throw at non-striker's end, misses and McGrath backs up
loopy delivery on the middle stump line, de Villiers comes down the track and drives through the on side
There comes the six. I was getting a bit itchy. Too long without one! de Villiers is down the track and to the pitch and the lovely swing of the bat and the ball soars over long on
on the off and middle stump line, defended on the front foot
floated from round the stumps, comes in with the angle and Smith pulls it to long on.
flatter, on the off stump line, driven to midwicket
lands on the middle stump line, breaks in and de Villiers tries to shovel it to the on side, misses and is rapped on the pad
Wood on leather this time. Slightly short and de Villiers rocks back to pull it to deep midwicket
Another pull. Another boundary. The run-feast continues, are you satiated yet though?
Deja-vu at St. Kitts. Symonds, for some reason, offers another short in length delivery, and de Villiers unfurls another pull shot.
leans forward and defends. Twice in a row. The scorers must be getting amazed at the two dot balls. What is happening?
drifting on the leg side, tickled to fine leg
Again they bowl short to de Villiers. This definitely can't be a plan unless you are a masochist. de Villiers whacks it to the cow corner.
on the middle and leg stump line, full in length, flicked past square-leg
Smith is clearly bored. Opts for a reverse-sweep this time, doesn't execute it well and ends up dabbing it to cover.
on the legs, de Villiers leans forward, works it past square-leg for another single
fires in a low full-toss, driven to long-on
flat and straight, on the middle and leg, driven past midwicket
full in length, on the middle, driven down the ground, to Bracken at long on

Watson gets the crucial breakthrough with a direct hit from long leg. It was the only way de Villiers was getting out. Huge wicket. Flicked to left of Watson and they think there is a two in it. de Villiers turns, rushes back but is beaten by the fast, flat and the direct hit. Australia's fielding comes to their rescue. All the players mob Watson.
Meanwhile, nothing has changed. Smith gets another boundary. Topspinner on the middle and off stump line, Smith backs away to cut it late. Very late.
gets a single with a nudge through square-leg
outside off stump, driven back down the track
floated on the off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
googly. lands on the middle stump line and breaks away. Kallis only sees it off the track, tries to adjust by wristing it away to the off side but makes no contact.
around the off stump line, dabbed to short third man
full, hint of inswing, on the off and middle line, driven back to the bowler
rushes through the channel outside off stump, Kallis has a poke and is beaten
Tait resumes normal service. Another wide down the leg side.
overpitched outside off stump, driven to mid-off
full and outside off, Kallis drives to left of cover where Hayden makes a tumbling stop.
half-volley outside off stump and Kallis  follows the footsteps of the other batsmen before him:  A fierce drive through the cover region.
full and well outside off stump, driven to cover. Four men inside the ring on the off side.

Gilchrist is amazed how Smith missed that full-toss and ends up giving byes. Smith charged down the track and missed a full-toss outside off stump. It bounces awkwardly in front of Gilchrist and shoots along the ground.
again full and outside off, steered to gully region. Clarke gets across from backward point

Pure drama. We saw a flood of 4s and 6s, here comes the penalty 5 runs.For hitting the cap behind Gilchrist. It was full and outside off, Smith hangs his bat out, gets a inside edge and it rolls over and his the cap. Gilchrist is donning the helmet and has placed the cap there. umpire Benson first signals a dead-ball . Smith screamed "why is it a dead-ball?". Benson walks over to  Bucknor who signals it is the penalty five runs.
way outside off stump, Smith can't reach it.
yorker-length on the off stump line, jabbed away
full and outside off, driven to mid-off
retains the strike with a dab to third man. Since he is taking a leg stump guard, and occasionally, backs away .. they are bowling at him outside off. Asking him to go and fetch it. Will it work?
full and on the leg and middle, whipped through midwicket.
bouncer at Kallis who ducks but his bat is held up like a periscope. Risky.
Full and on the off and middle stump line, Kallis drives but is beaten by the movement, gets a inside-edge on to the pad
attempted yorker turns into a low full toss, on the legs, flicked to short fine-leg
banged in short of length, outside off stump, pulled to midwicket.
at the blockhole. On the middle and off stump line, swinging in late, Kallis drives to mid-off. This is the most economical over of the innings.
low full toss on the off stump line, driven to mid-off
great delivery first-up. Yorker on the middle stump line, stabbed away to the off side.
leans forward, defends a full-length delivery to cover
lands on the middle and leg, moves towards the hip, clipped away behind square-leg
short in length and outside off, run down to third man for yet another single
full in length, outside off stump, driven on the up to cover

overpitched on the middle stump line, driven to long-on. Slight fumble by McGrath there and they will turn for the second run. Direct hit could have been interesting. Gibbs might have been short of his crease.
yorker-length, on the off stump line, again late swing, and dug out by Gibbs.
Another in-swinging yorker. This has been a very good spell from Tait. Gibbs takes out his left leg from the line and jabs the delivery to midwicket
full in length, on the off stump line, steered to backward point region
tossed on the off stump line, swept past square-leg.
Valuable boundary. First in 19 balls. Gibbs leans across and paddles a delivery from outside off, down to fine leg
on the off and middle, swept behind square-leg
bottom-edged to the boundary. On the middle stump line, Kallis goes for a sweep, gets a bottom edge and it runs down to fine-leg boundary.
on the off and middle stump line, driven to cover
loopy delivery on the middle stump line, dabbed to the on side
short in length, homing in on the off stump line, pushed to cover.
slower one, on the off and middle stump line, Gibbs reads it, leans forward, drives to cover point for a single. 200 up. 178 to win in 21.4 overs.
banged in short and Kallis pulls but straight to Hussey at deep midwicket. The cow corner was getting ready to be hit but he send it straight to the fielder.
full and outside off, Gibbs slashes it down to third man
Kallis walks to leg side, then back to where he was and ends up whipping a fullish delivery on the middle to midwicket.
yorker-length, on the off stump line, driven to deep cover
leans forward and defends. Only 20  runs in the last five overs. The squeeze is on.
almost caught by Ponting at backward square-leg. Kallis goes for a sweep, gets a top-edge and it flies to left of Ponting who makes a desperate attempt to get it but can't reach it.
leans back, flicks to backward square leg
faboulous late cut. Leans back to a delivery turning in from outside off and cuts it fine.
floated on the middle stump line, Kallis goes for a drive but is beaten in the flight.  The bat-handle rotates and the ball rolls over to midwicket
short and on the off stump line, pulled away. Ponting, at midwicket,  makes a half-stop with a full-length dive
in the zone outside off, dabbed to third man
length-delivery on the off and middle stump line, dabbed to point
full, on the middle and leg, driven to long on for a single.
beaten. Full and in the corridor outside off, Kallis drives but he tries to go too square and doesn't make contact
full, straight, driven inside-out to cover.
on the middle stump line, swept to long leg
There comes the big hit. Gibbs charges down the track and hits it cleanly right over the bowler's head

done in by the googly. Loopy delivery that pitched on the middle stump line, on a length, and Gibbs shapes to drive to the on side and is beaten by the wrong'un. Gilchrist whips the bails off in a flash and Gibbs's back foot was still in the air. Wonderful delivery from Hogg.
Prince is beaten by the orthodox legbreak. Lands on the middle and off stump line and breaks away.
loopy delivery that dipped in front of off stump line, driven to cover
on the middle stump line, swept to long leg
full in length, just outside off stump and Kallis steers it down to third man
Another one goes. Prince pulls straight to deep square-leg. Banged in short, climbes head-high and Prince pulls it to Hayden. Australia are tightening the screws here.
full in length, outside off stump, driven to left of mid-off.
McGrath hurls in another bouncer. Not so lucky this time. Pulled away to long leg for a single.
fuller and around off stump, driven to cover point
full-pitched, outside off stump, driven to mid-on.
outside the off stump, run down to short third man.
flighted delivery outside off stump, turns in and Boucher attempts to play it with the spin, misses and is rapped on the pad
slightly short of length, cut to point
googly down the leg side, turns in but not enough, wide called though it was just missing the stumps
whipped away from outside off to the leg side for a single
full outside off, swept away to short fine for a single.
back of a length and outside off, typical McGrath length, Boucher tries to pull but it doesn't bounce as much as he expected.
tapped away to the off side, straight to cover. McGrath tightening things here. The equation is getting tougher and tougher by the minute.
back of a length outside off, tries to cut but gets an under-edge to point for a single
Glided away square of third man for another single. Surely something has to give soon.
Well-directed yorker on leg stump, Boucher can only dig it out. No room, no length. McGrath turning the screws. This could be the crucial phase
Slightly short and Boucher goes for the pre-meditated swipe, gets a single to midwicket but that's a fine over. Just three from it. In the context of this game, it's like a maiden.
Good start. Outside off, length ball. Boucher drives but straight to gully

Straighter this time and Boucher flicks it away to midwicket. Takes off for a quick single but Ponting is quick to swoop down and take a shy at the non-striker's end. Had it hit, that could have been close
Driven to cover. Kallis seems to be biding his time. Will they leave it for too late?
Gives himself room and glides it to third man. Singles, dots, singles .. Australia giving nothing away here
Cuts a slightly short of a length delivery but Michael 'Pup' Clarke dives full-length to his right and half-stops the ball. Fine athletecism there
Driven forcefully but Symonds, that great fielder, is prowling there. Dives to his right. The pressure is building and it's not Australia who are at the receiving end
Fine yorker to start off. Well directed on leg stump. Boucher can only dig it out straight to Ponting at midwicket. Pressure Pressure.

Length ball outside off and Boucher goes for the slog sweep. Doesn't time it well and Hussey gets around it in a flash, stopping the boundary. The batsmen have to settle for two. Australia pulling out all the stops now. They're not defending champions for nothing
Drip-drip. Boucher drives it straight to cover. No run again.
Low full toss, Boucher backs away and crashes it past the bowler for four. Ball races away straight past the bowler. Burns the grass, almost
That's the blitzer. Short ball and Boucher pulls with a crisp swoosh, ball soars high, high and into the stand at deep point. They're turning it on now.
low full toss, driven to long-on. Boucher retains the strike. In this mood, he must.
Length ball and straight, Boucher tries to go for the pre-meditated swipe but decides to pat it to the off side. Fielders prowling all over, it seems. Australia on the ball
WIde of off but Boucher can't get it away. Straight to short third man.
Gives himself room, backs away way outside leg and pats it to cover. Quick single though Symonds threatens to hit the stumps even then. He's all over South Africa
Cover drive from Kallis and guess who's there? That man Symonds. He's all over the off side, then there's daylight
Flicked away behind square for a single.
Length ball and straight. Boucher thinks of improvising but decides to tap it to cover. Symonds picks up but they manage a single easily.
Slightly short and Boucher pulls it away in front of square for a single
Full and wide outside off and Kallis on his knees and drives it to cover. That's a region where Andrew 'Roy' Symonds is patrolling. Not much of a chance
Oh, there is a chance. Fine, crisp, cover-drive from Kallis that pierces the field. Gives himself room and creams it past the gap in the cover for a fine four
slightly short of a length, back-cut for a single

That's the sucker punch. He's been short of a length throughout this over and now he pulls out the lethal weapon. Close to 140 kph, full, fast swinging yorker. Boucher had already lined up for the swipe across the line and the inside edge rattles off stump. That was the crucial wicket. Tait has got it.
Tait welcomes him with a short ball. Hello, he seems to be saying. Kemp sways away well. FIne over. He was called on to take the wicket and he delivered. South Africa need 122 from 66 now.
Short of a length, Kallis tries to steer to third man but can't make contact.
full and on the middle and leg, driven to long on
off cutter, rushing through the channel, outside off, and kemp is beaten trying to run it down to third man
another off cutter, on the off stump line, pushed to long-off
full and on the leg stump line, run down to third man
Smokes that one. Fullish, on the off and middle and drilled inside-out through extra cover.
full in length, on the middle stump line, Kallis stays adjacent to the line, opens the bat-face, steers to point.
length-delivery, on the middle stump line, hit on the up to long-off
short in length, outside off, guided to point

full, furious, and it curves in late, around the middle and leg stump line. Kemp is caught at the crease, the bat comes down in an angle and the ball thuds into the pad. Would have taken out leg. Another big-hitter is gone.
yorker-length, on the off stump line, driven through the off side
short in length and pulled to deep midwicket
on the off stump line and swept away to long leg

It's all over for Smith. He had to go for it. The run-rate was rocketing. Floated on the middle stump line and he went for a slog-sweep. Top-edges a dolly to Gilly.  He had batted in a fiesty manner at the start of the innings but the cramps did him in.
googly and Pollock can't pick it.
conventional leg break, short in length and pulled away to deep square-leg
pushes tentatively at a loopy delivery on the middle stump line, gets an inside-edge that takes it past square-leg.
full and straight, driven through the on side.
146.1 k, bouncer and Kallis shapes to pull but it's too quick for him.
ouch. 140 k. Full in length, lands on the middle stump line, slides in to evade the slog from Kallis and thuds into the inner thigh. Kallis doubles up in pain.
143.0 k, full and swinging in around off stump, Kallis goes on a bent knee, drives but not much power and Tait makes the stop
another yorker-length, on the leg stump line, Kallis gets his bat down and stabs it to the on side
another screaming yorker. Homing in on the foot. Kallis gets his feet out of the line, jabs it to the leg side and takes the single. Tait is bowling very well with the old ball.
released with a grunt. This one doesn't quite land into the blockhole, flicked through square-leg

Kallis falls. Hogg claims another wicket. Charges down the track, Hogg drags back the length and he sends it straight down the throat of long-on. Kallis will be accused of slow-batting. He came in, the run rate slowed down, the required rate shot up like a thermometer, the pressure increased and the noose tightened.
googly down the leg side, doesn't turn in enough.
tossed up, on the off stump line, driven to long on
Hogg teases Hall with a googly. Can't pick it and is beaten
in the channel outside off stump, Hall tries to drill it through the off side but makes no contact
turns in from outside off, nudged to the on side
Watto cleans up Pollock. Full, straight, on the leg stump line, Pollock has one almighty swing, bat meets air, ball meets leg stump. SA are fading away.

Full and straight, Langveldt has a slog, gets a inside-edge, lands adjacent to the left boot and then thuds into the shoe and bounds off to Ponting at point who takes it. They appeal for a catch. Bucknor is not sure, consults Benson. He is also not sure. They go upstairs and verdict is not out.
133k bouncer and Langeveldt sways away in a hurry.
on the middle stump line, dabbed to short third man
yorker, on the leg stump line, nudged to the off side
short in length, on the off stump line, slapped across the line, to deep midwicket

Bracken joins in the party.  The slower one does the trick. Full in length, lands on the middle stump line, and breaks away towards the off stump. Langeveldt tries to run it down to third man, misses and the off stump is pegged back. Australia are just a wicket away from a big win.
length-delivery, angling away from Ntini who lets it go through. Gilchrist is standing up to the stumps
slower through the air, fuller, Ntini lunges forward, drives to mid-off
on a length, around off and middle stump line, pushed to mid-off
Hello?! Ntini  creams that one. Fullish, outside off stump and drilled past the bowler and to the long-off boundary.
yorker, swings in late, on the middle and leg stump line, jabbed away behind square-leg
attempted yorker, on the middle stump line, driven to long-on.
pushes it further outside off stump, sliced down to third man
full-pitched on the off stump line, biffed away to long-off
full and on the middle stump line, driven past the bowler
full in length, outside off and it shapes away. Hall pushes at it, inside the line and is beaten
leans forward and drives to long-off
slower one. Ntini is beaten in the air but goes through with the stroke and shovels it through mid-off
yorker-length, on the middle and leg stump line, dug out, back to the bowler
in the zone outside off stump, run down to third man

Australia win by 83 runs. Yorker on the off stump line, Ntini tries to get his bat down but the ball beats the bat and the furniture is disturbed. HRG chimes in with a timely stat.  Ponting becomes the most successful captain in ODI history. This is win no 108, besting Border's record.
